Plot Candlestick Chart

Source: R/charts.R
plot_candles.Rd

Create beautiful candlestick charts with optional volume bars and indicator overlays. Automatically handles multiple symbols with faceting.

Usage

plot_candles(
  data,
  title = NULL,
  subtitle = NULL,
  show_volume = TRUE,
  volume_height = 0.2,
  color_up = "#26a69a",
  color_down = "#ef5350",
  theme_dark = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

Data frame with columns: datetime, open, high, low, close, (optional) volume

title

Chart title (default: auto-generated)

subtitle

Chart subtitle (default: NULL)

show_volume

Show volume bars below (default: TRUE)

volume_height

Relative height of volume panel (default: 0.2)

color_up

Color for up candles (default: "#26a69a")

color_down

Color for down candles (default: "#ef5350")

theme_dark

Use dark theme (default: FALSE)

Value

A ggplot object or patchwork object (if volume shown)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(tradeio)
data <- fetch_prices("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")
plot_candles(data)
plot_candles(data, show_volume = FALSE, theme_dark = TRUE)
} # }
